publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / beta maṣāḥǝft

revisionDesc.change: generated first version of the ODD from requirements

moduleRef.except: argument byline closer div1 div2 div3 div4 div5 div6 div7 imprimatur opener postscript salute signed titlePage titlePart trailer
climate education geoFeat langKnowledge langKnown nameLink population socecStatus terrain trait
broadcast equipment incident kinesic pause recording recordingStmt scriptStmt shift u vocal writing
activity channel constitution derivation domain factuality interaction locale preparedness purpose setting textDesc

valItem.desc: scratched with a knife or similar
crossed out with red or black ink, a line or dashes
marked with dots above or below the line
deleted or washed out, the material is untouched
text written at the foot of the page
text written within the body of the text
text written in the margin (left, right, or both)
text written on the opposite, i.e. facing, page
text written on the other side of the leaf
text written over previously deleted text
text written at the top of the page

sch:rule.sch:report: There should be a space before and one after the element date

valItem.desc: records with this type represent an ethnic group as a whole and in general

sch:rule.sch:report: For an exact date, please use @when.

valItem.desc: Text dated by nomenclature or onomastics
Text dated by known persons named or implied within it
Text dated by the reign of a ruler
Text dated by the use of official titles
Text dated by explicit internal date
Archaeological, epigraphic, iconographic or other context of the text support

sch:rule.sch:report: Please, don't use @from and @to in citedRange, write the range into the element

An Empty citedRange is not allowed, remove it if you don't need it or please enter the page range, unit number according to need and use @unit to specifiy the type of range. Multiple citedRange are allowed.

valItem.desc: The manuscript is badly preserved and severely damaged.
The manuscript is preserved with minimal damages.
The manuscript is preserved completely undamaged.
If you use this value, please provide in the description a proper motivation, otherwise avoid it.

works of unknown or doubtful authorship rejected from the set of the canonical scriptures, e.g., the book of Enoch, Jubilees, Herma, the Miracles of Mary, the Miracles of Jesus, Maṣḥafa ṭomār, the apocryphal Acts of the Apostles, etc.
biblical books belonging to the New Testament.
biblical books belonging to the Old Testament.
works belonging to the biblical canon, subdivided into the Old and New Testament.
works containing the description of the life events of an individual.
works containing regulations for the government of the Christian organizations, e.g., the Sinodos, the Fətḥa Nagaśt, the Śərʿata faws manfasāwi.
works containing texts of unspecified Tigrinya subject.
works containing texts of unspecified Amharic subject.
works containing texts of unspecified Jewish subject.
works containing texts of unspecified Christian subject.
works and collections of works containing the Vita (Life) of a saint, included the cycles of miracles performed by the saint himself, as well as Acts and Passiones of martyrs.
works containing land grants, Amharic historical works of the 19th century which cannot be labelled chronicles, the history of churches and monasteries, biographies etc.
works containing royal and other chronicles e.g., Tārik za-Walda ʿAmid, Zenā ʾAyhud and various treatises of Ethiopian history.

works and collections of works containing homiletic texts to be read on the occasion of specific commemorative days, e.g., the homiliaries in honour of Michael and Gabriel, Dərsāna sanbat krəstiyan, Dərsān māḥyāwi, Dərsāna madḫāne ʿalam, etc.
works containing texts of Islamic subject.
texts that formally record grants and rights to institutions and individuals, such as land charters, donation acts, land grants.
works containing directives for the liturgy of the office services (except for the mass and rituals like weddings and funerals), e.g., Maṣḥafa nəfq, the Horologium, etc.
works containing scriptural readings to be read on various religious occasions (fast, feasts, liturgical periods), e.g. Maṣḥafa gəṣṣəw, Maṣḥafa ʾaśləti, etc.
works containing directives for the celebration of religious offices such as weddings and funerals, e.g., Maṣḥafa taklil and Maṣḥafa gənzat.
works containing liturgical instructions for the celebration of the mass, e.g. Maṣḥafa qəddāse.
works containing magic texts, prayers and formulas to be recited or carried along for healing and as a protection from demons, diseases and natural accidents, e.g. Maftəḥe śərāy, etc.
works containing medical texts and recipes for healing.
works containing texts of various unspecified nature.
works containing texts to be read for the education and edification of the monastic community members, e.g., Mār Yəsḥāq, Filkəsyos, ʾAragāwi manfasāwi, etc.
works containing observations and investigations into a number of natural phenomena.
works belonging to other literary genres.
works containing praises, ʿarke-hymns, salām-hymns, malkəʾ, songs and canticles, texts subdivided into stanzas, rhymed texts.
works containing prayers, supplications and invocations to God and other revered entities.
works containing philosophical texts and sentences, as Maṣḥafa falāsfā ṭabibān
works containing patristic texts dealing with theological subjects, e.g. Qerəllos, Hāymānota ʾAbaw, the Five Pillars of Mystery, etc.
exegetical works containing the interpretation of biblical texts, e.g, the Tərgʷāme and ʾAndəmtā corpus.
works containing texts for the calculation of the moveable feasts and for other calendrical computes, e.g., ʾAbušākər, Bāḥra ḥassāb.
A particular type of a manuscript - usually a main copy of the Four Gospels of a church - where documents (land charters, foundation charters, etc) concerning the place are collected.
Items belonging to the Christian tradition which do not contain text, such as miniature collections.

sch:rule.sch:report: ref must be used with either a @corresp pointing to a project xml:id or a @target pointing to a an internal id or a @cRef pointing to an external urn, like those in Perseus
Please use @corresp only for external entities, assigning also a @type. if you need to point to something into the current file or to a resource external to the project use @target.

Please use @target if you need to point to something into the current file (e.g. #h1) or to point to a resource external to the project (http://www.example.com). if you need to point to a mss, use @corresp
There should be a space before and one after the element ref

title in a Work entity must always have an @xml:id which identifies alternative titles or a @corresp pointing to one of such xml:ids. Format of the id should be like t1 t2, etc. and thus in @corresp #t1, #t2, etc.
title in work must always have an @xml:id which identifies alternative titles and/or a @ref pointing to the correct Work entity. Format of the id should be like t1 t2, etc.
Titles of works must have ids starting with the letter 't' followed by a progressive number, e.g. t1, t2, t3
There should be a space before and one after the element title

valItem.desc: the work is contained completely in the manuscript
the work is contained incompetely in the manuscript, i.e. even only a small part is missing
syriaca.org: an existing print catalogue provides a descriptive title
syriaca.org: a title for such work established by the editor or cataloguer
for titleStmt, specifies to which title to give priority in output.
Descriptions in manuscript catalogues of the subject of the record
ID of the work in an external clavis (CC, CPG etc.)
Secondary bibliography on the subject of the record
Ruler of a country, region or similar
Occupation within an academic institution or independently pursuing academic interests

sch:rule.sch:report: The unique tag in Zotero to be used in this pointers should be namespaced. Please make sure that the tag in zotero begins with bm: and copy it here exactely as it is, without spaces.
we use citedRange, not biblScope. Please, see guidelines wiki on Beta Masaheft.

Please, don't point to bibliography items for witnesses as it is unlikely that the edition of the text is based on secondary literature. use @corresp to point to the id of a manuscript. If the record does not exist, consider creating it as a minimss using the provided models and guidelines. If you point to an external digital reproduction, use @facs and enter the permalink to the main view. You will still need to create a minimss if the record does not exist.

valItem.desc: to be used for places and institutions
to be used in binding description
note stating that the manuscript has been donated to an individual or to an institution.
note stating the book belongs to an individual or to an institution.
note stating that the book has been purchased for money by an individual or an institution.
note stating that the manuscript has been generically acquired by an individual or an institution. Similar to “PurchaseNote”.
note written down as a receipt of a transaction of goods.
note admonishing individuals to a righteous behavior. See also “Exhortation”.
note stating the concession of lands by an authority in favor of individuals or typically of institutions.
act of foundation of an institution.
note containing the spiritual genealogy of the leader of the community or an institution, or the family members of an individual.
entreat to God for help, written down in a later hand.
note added at the end of the main text concerning its completion.
hymn or praise to God or other entities.
note addressed to the brethren in order to commemorate a saint, to celebrate a given feast or for educational purposes.
invocation against those who stole or erased the book or against other individuals. Not very different from “Condemnation”.
list of books or items held by the individual or the institution.
note stating a transaction of goods between individuals or institutions.
scribe’s note on commencing the work
scribe’s note on ordering of the copying
scribe’s note on commissioning of the writing
scribe’s note on completing the writing
scribe’s note on assigning of land.
documentary record concerning a transaction of goods.
documentary record concerning the distribution of goods or lands.
documentary record concerning the guarantors of a transaction or a loan.
generic note of a documentary, official character.
note whose content is hardly understandable.
list of the guarantors of transaction or a loan.
commemorative notice on a saint. Mainly taken from the Synaxarion.
note condemning those who stole the book or erased it.
prayer to be read or carried along for protective purposes.
note containing a generic poetic text. See “PoemArke”, “PoemQene”, “PoemSalam”.
rhymed composition fulfilling the requirements of the Qəne-hymn.
short rhymed poem beginning with the words “salām (ʾəbəl) la-”.
stamp affixed by the owning institution, e.g., a library.
note for calculating the moveable feasts and for other calendrical computes.
fragment of a literary work added at a later stage to a manuscript. See also “GuestText”.
communication formally addressed to an individual or an institution.
set form of words to be recited or carried along for healing and protecting.
elaborate note to be recited or carried along for healing and protecting.
note added at a later stage in order to comment word or passages of the main text. See also “Gloss”.
note added at a later stage in order to correct words or passages of the main text.
note added at a later stage in order to interpret or explain words or passages of the main text. See also “Comment”.
note excommunicating an individual from a religious community, e.g., a monastery.
a complete work, provided with its own ID, added later to a manuscript.

sch:rule.sch:report: ab in layout should always have a type and optionally a subtype

ab in note is used in listPlace for institutions and should always have a @type equal to 'history' or 'description'. @type equal to 'appellation' can be used to list a series of ways in which a place is called.
Dividers must have ids starting with 'div' followed by a progressive number, e.g. div1, div2, div3
an ab[@type='appellation'] must contain a list.
seg in layout should always have a type
DecoNotes must have ids starting with the letter 'd' followed by a progressive number, e.g. d1, d2, d3
DecoNotes in Binding Description must have ids starting with the letter 'b' followed by a progressive number, e.g. b1, b2, b3

valItem.desc: ornamental band is above the page

sch:rule.sch:report: Manuscript parts ids must start with the letter 'p' followed by a progressive number, e.g. p1, p1.3, p1.1_i1.1

The Underscore is used in ids to mark a nesting of different ids, especially items in parts. there should thus be only one of them as a maximum. If you have parts into parts or items into items, please use a full stop. p1.2_i3.4 is e.g. the subitem 4 of item 3 in subpart 2 of part 1.

Content Items in Manuscript parts must have ids starting with the reference to the part in which they are contained, then underscore and the letter 'i' followed by a progressive number, e.g. p1.1_i1.1, p1.1_i2.

The Underscore is used in ids to mark a nesting of different ids, especially items in parts. there should thus be only one of them as a maximum. If you have parts into parts or items into items, please use a full stop. p1.2_i3.4 is e.g. the subitem 4 of item 3 in subpart 2 of part 1.
Colophon in Manuscript items must have ids starting with coloph.
HandNotes must have ids starting with the letter 'h' followed by a progressive number, e.g. h1, h2, h3

elementSpec.desc: It is very important, at the end of each section of work of improvement of a record to record a change in the revisionDesc element of the teiHeader. In the attribute who enter your id, in the when enter the date of the change, in the format YYYY-MM-DD. Inside the element, briefly describe the changes you have made. When you are done with a file, please, add a change element with content completed. If you have reviewed and corrected a file which is now ready and published, please add a change with content reviewed

sch:rule.sch:report: This is not a correct date.
A persName in a mss, place or work description should always contain an attribute @ref pointing to the relevant record
There should be a space before and one after the element persName

valItem.desc: the person who donated the manuscript
the person who donated the manuscript, tipically to a library
the owner of a ms or an item
the commissioner of a ms or an item
the saint to whom the tabot is dedicated
the person paying for a ms (possibly not the same as donor/commissioner)
the normalized transcription of the name in fidal
name given on coronation (kings but also patriarchs)
name given on entering monastic life
the name of the battle horse of kings and rulers
a name given to a person associated to his occupation or other deeds
nom de guerre (if different from horse name, e.g. Malas)
short form (diminutive or abbreviated, e.g. Taklo for Takla Maryam)
father's name, esp. for eventual Russian names, but could be also highlighted in others

sch:rule.sch:report: A placeName in a mss, person or work description should always contain an attribute @ref pointing to the relevant record
There should be a space before and one after the element placeName

valItem.desc: note originally added at the end of the main text concerning its completion. not to be confused with later additions

sch:rule.sch:report: At least the first objectDesc of msDesc must have attribute form specified.

valItem.desc: manuscript format consisting of quires bound together to the spine, in their turn made up of a variable number of leaves sewn together and protected by two hard boards.
manuscript format consisting of one continuous flow of writing material rolled up, generally around one or two wooden cylindrical supports.
manuscript format consisting of one leaf assembled in a multiple zig-zag folding, resembling an accordion, and generally enclosed between two hard boards.
manuscript format consisting of one single unbound sheet.
An inscribed object different from a codex, scroll or leaf

sch:rule.sch:report: a relation element is only allowed within a listRelation

valItem.desc: the relation between a ms and the first printed edition of a text it contains
is the mother of the legally conjugated partner
is the father of the legally conjugated partner
is the husband of the daugther
is the brother of the legally conjugated partner
is the brother of the legally conjugated partner
is the wife of the daugther
This person has a Tābot at the location...
Ordained priest, bishop or monk. Same as Consecrated.
has ordained to a religious ministery ...

The subject of the relation is author of a translation of a work in another language and there is no digital resource enabling us to document the authorship of this work and the fact that the work as such is a translation of another work.

The relation between a Golden Gospel and its original institution (even if the manuscript is now kept in a different place), to be used in cases where the definition of "Golden Gospel" is explicitly mentioned somewhere in the Gospel or when there is enough evidence that the Gospel is the main material repository of documentary texts related to a certain institution.

sch:rule.sch:report: the outermost div must always have an attribute type edition, bibliography, commentary, translation or apparatus; type textpart is to be used inside edition.

valItem.desc: to contain apparatus criticus or textual notes
to contain bibliographical information, previous publications, etc.
to contain all editorial commentary, historical/prosopographical discussion, etc.
to contain the text of the edition itself; may include multiple text-parts
used to divide a div[type=edition] into multiple parts (fragments, columns, faces, etc.)
to contain a translation of the text into one or more modern languages
this container is for a book and may contain chapters
this container is for a chapter and may contain sections
this container is for a stanza and may contain verses
to be used for canonical texts like LIT2688CanonsNicaea2

sch:rule.sch:report: Each record must have a type with one of the values suggested.

attDef.desc: For Manuscripts e.g. EMML2312 ES15 (Ethio-SPaRe) BLadd100 (British Library, fondo, numero) BNFabb3 (Bibliotheque nationale de France, fondo, numero) Works = LIT1001Homili (LIT + incremental number + first world of title) Places = LOC2969Ensala (LOC + incremental number + first world of place name) People = PRS1001AbbaTam (PRS + incremental number + first world of name) Institutions = INS0030Addaqaharsi (INS + 4 digit number + first world of name)

valItem.desc: Description of an institution where manuscripts are preserved
Description of a recognizable literary or documentary work at any given granularity
Description of a Narrative Unit, independent of the Work or textual unit to which it is part. This includes document types, e.g. used to classify additiones to a manuscript.
Description of a concept used as authority list (faith, art element)

sch:rule.sch:report: At least one date must be specified, preferably with a type to indicate the origin of it and evidence
Coordinates should be written as decimal degrees separated by a single space e.g. "14.165289 39.447665" latitude first.

Please use one for line for each point defining the polygon. Please do not add spaces at the beginning and end of the sequence. You can draw your polygon with https://www.keene.edu/campus/maps/tool/ and copy past directly from there. Just take care, please, to remove the commas afterwards..

Please use one for line for each point defining the polygon. Please do not add spaces at the beginning and end of the sequence. You can draw your polygon with https://www.keene.edu/campus/maps/tool/ and copy past directly from there. Just take care, please, to remove the commas afterwards..

Please use one for line for each point defining the polygon. Please do not add spaces at the beginning and end of the sequence. You can draw your polygon with https://www.keene.edu/campus/maps/tool/ and copy past directly from there. Just take care, please, to remove the commas afterwards..

valItem.desc: If the commemoration is repeated, please add this value as well in type
ʿĀmata ʿālam/ʿĀmata ʾəm-fəṭrat (Era of the World)
ʿĀmata śəggāwe (Era of the Incarnation – Ethiopian)

sch:rule.sch:report: locus must have either an exact reference to a page with @target or a range indicated with @from and @to or either of the two if the other extreme of the range is unknown. Please do not use "unknown" as value.
items in collation must have an @xml:id
Items in Collation must have ids starting with the letter 'q' followed by a progressive number, e.g. q1, q2, q3
items in additions must have an @xml:id
Additions must have ids starting with the letter 'a' followed by a progressive number, e.g. a1, a2, a3. In case of other contents (varia) use an id starting with 'e.
The locus of the addition should be child of the item, not of desc. Please move it outside of the desc element, just before it for exemple.

valItem.desc: Characters supplied from a parallel version of this text, absent from this one
Characters visible to a previous editor, now lost/unclear due to damage
Restoration of text completely lost from the surface
Supplement of text erroneously omitted from the surface by the scribe/cutter
Editorial supplement of words subaudible to the native reader
Editorial explanation of oblique text in original
Text restored (e.g. from earlier witness or alternate copy) without specification of current state of this text
space voluntarily left e.g. for later rubrication never accomplished
spaces left for rubrication, which were left unfilled
No better specification available, there is simply a gap.
Traces of text remains on the surface but cannot be interpreted
Text erroneously omitted from the surface by the scribe/cutter
Text omitted from the edition by the editor, for whatever reason (brevity, context, language, etc.)
